What is coal bed methane
Coal bed methane is a type of natural gas that is extracted from coal seams. It is often used for industrial and domestic purposes.
Summarise regulation about main ventilator in mines

Regulation 154 states that every main mechanical ventilator in a mine must be capable of producing adequate ventilation and must be installed on the surface at least 10 meters from the opening of the shaft or incline. If electricity is used for driving the ventilator, two different sources of power must be provided and a recording instrument must be installed to continuously register the pressure developed. The current of air must be able to be reversed when necessary. If the Regional Inspector is of the opinion that the ventilation is not adequate, they may require the installation and maintenance of a mechanical ventilator that is capable of producing adequate ventilation.

Can you tell me what are the regulations on coal mine methane in cmr

The Coal Mines Regulations, 2017 (CMR) include regulations on coal mine methane in Chapter XVII, Miscellaneous. These regulations include requirements for giving notice of commencement of extraction of methane, plans and sections of the mine or part thereof, protective work, and fences.
What is degree of gassiness

Degree of gassiness is a classification of coal seams according to the percentage of inflammable gas in the general body of air or the rate of emission of such gas. Gassy seams are classified into three degrees: first degree, second degree, and third degree.
Explain what is degree one gassiness of mines

Degree one gassiness of mines is a coal seam or part thereof lying within the precincts of a mine not being an open cast working where the percentage of inflammable gas in the general body of air at any place in the workings of the seam does not exceed 0.1 and the rate of emission of such gas does not exceed one cubic meter per tonne of coal produced.

What are the regulations for Outlets of a mine

Regulation 71 states that every part of a mine shall be provided with at least two ways of affording means of egress to the surface. Regulation 74 states that if any doubt arises as to whether the provision of two such ways is practicable or not, it shall be referred to the Chief Inspector for decision. Regulation 75 states that every shaft, incline and other outlet provided as required by regulation 71 shall be examined, once at least in every seven days, by an overman or other competent person and a report of every such examination shall immediately thereafter be recorded in a bound paged book kept for the purpose and shall be signed and dated by the person making the examination. Regulation 73 states that every entrance to a mine from the surface, and the top and all entrances between the top and bottom, including the sump, if any, of every working, ventilating or pumping shaft, shall be kept securely fenced so designed and constructed as to prevent any person accidentally falling down the shaft or coming into contact with a moving part of the hoisting equipment provided in the shaft. Regulation 73 also states that every walkable entrance from the surface to the workings belowground shall be provided with a substantial gate which shall be kept closed and locked when there are no persons belowground.

What is Coal Bed Methane
Coal Bed Methane is a type of natural gas that is found in coal seams. It is extracted from coal beds and is used for a variety of purposes, including energy production.
What are the regulations related to Coal bed methane

Regulations related to Coal bed methane include code of safe practices and standard operating procedures for development, extraction, storage, transport and all other related operations, required for extraction of abandoned mine methane or coal mine methane as the case may be, and training of work persons, staff and officials involved in exploration or recovery of coal mine methane or abandoned mine methane project and activities. Fences must also be kept securely around any tanks or reservoirs or other dangerous places in or about a mine.

what is notice of opening

Notice of opening is a notice that must be given to the Chief Inspector, the Regional Inspector, and the District Magistrate when a mine or seam is intended to be reopened after abandonment, closure, or discontinuance for a period exceeding sixty days. The notice must be given not less than thirty days before resumption of mining operations.
what are the provided conditions for the notice of change in ownership and appointment of agent, manager, etc:

The provided conditions for the notice of change in ownership and appointment of agent, manager, etc are that the owner, agent or manager must give notice to the Chief Inspector and the Regional Inspector within seven days from the date of the change, and if the owner is a firm or other association of individuals, a change of any partner, member, director, or shareholder must also be intimated to the Chief Inspector and the Regional Inspector within seven days from the date of the change. Additionally, the previous owner or his agent must make over to the new owner or his agent, within a period of seven days of the transfer of ownership, all plans, sections, reports, registers and other records maintained in pursuance of the Act and of the regulations, or orders made thereunder, and all correspondence relating to the working of the mine relevant thereto. Finally, no manager shall vacate his office without giving due notice in writing to the owner or agent at least thirty days before the day on which he wishes to vacate his office, unless the owner or agent permits the manager to vacate his office after giving a shorter notice.

No person shall be admitted as a candidate at any examination held by the Board unless they are at least 20 years of age. They must also hold a valid first-aid certificate of the St. John Ambulance Association (India) or any other equivalent standard as may be specified by the Chief Inspector. They must also submit a certificate of age verified by a Gazetted Officer of the Government or by the headmaster of a recognised school of a higher secondary or equivalent standard, a medical certificate obtained not more than one year prior to the date of their application, and a certificate from some person of good repute as to the general good conduct and sobriety of the candidate. summarize chapter II

Chapter II of the regulations outlines the requirements for submitting a notice of opening a mine, including a plan showing the boundaries of the mine and the shafts or openings of the mine, tri-junction or revenue pillars and other prominent and permanent surface features. It also outlines the requirements for keeping separate plans and sections for the working of every seam or of every separate section of every seam, and for demarcating zones and sections in the workings below ground. It also outlines the requirements for making determinations of temperature, humidity and other environmental conditions at specified points, and for submitting a written report if the percentage of inflammable gas exceeds one and a quarter.

What is the rule for Communication?

Rule 233 states that proper means of efficient and effective telephonic communication system shall be installed and maintained in between surface and belowground working and at the strategic points all along gas transportation pipe lines in belowground ground as well as on surface, which shall be of type approved by the Chief Inspector. Adequate precautions shall be taken to prevent signal and telephone wires coming into contact with other cables and electrical apparatus; signal wires shall be supported on insulators, and shall not be energised at more than thirty volts; contact makers shall be so constructed as to prevent accidental closing of the circuit; and in every gassy seam of the second or third degree, all signaling or telephonic communication circuits shall be constructed, installed, protected, operated and maintained in such a manner as to be intrinsically safe.
What is the rule for General safety?

Section/Rule 239 states that no person shall negligently or willfully do anything likely to endanger life or limb in the mine, or negligently or willfully omit to do anything necessary for the safety of the mine or the persons employed therein.
What is the rule for Information about sickness?

Section/Rule 245 states that every official or competent person shall, in case of sickness or of lawful absence, give early and sufficient notice thereof to his superior official or the manager, as the case may be, so that a substitute may be arranged.
Describe the rule for Sirdars and overmen

Rule 247 states that no person can be appointed as a competent person unless they hold either an Overman's Certificate or a Manager's Certificate. Rule 33 states that the manager and superior to the Sirdar must hold either a Manager's Certificate or an Overman's Certificate. Rule 48 states that the Sirdar shall take reasonable means to ensure proper observance of the requirements of the Act and of the regulations, and orders made thereunder by persons under his charge and shall, as soon as practicable, report any contravention thereof to his superior official. The Sirdar shall also make such inspection and reports as are required by these regulations, and in making such examination, he shall pay particular attention to edges of the goaf, if any, for checking supports and for presence of gas. If the Sirdar observes any dangerous place during the course of his inspections or if any danger at a place where work persons are employed is reported to him, he shall, if the danger is not possible to be removed forthwith, withdraw all persons from such place and shall not leave the place until the danger has been removed in his presence or all approaches to the place have been fenced off so as to prevent persons from inadvertently entering such place.
